benchmark_details.name: ArgCMV (Argument Summarization Benchmark for the LLM-era)
benchmark_details.overview: ArgCMV is a key point-based argument summarization benchmark consisting of long-context, multi-turn arguments from actual online human debates sourced from Reddit’s r/ChangeMyView, aiming to evaluate the key point extraction task with complex arguments.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a benchmark for key point extraction in argument summarization, improving upon the limitations of previous datasets like ArgKP21.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: Limited number of arguments in certain topics and restricted to discussions occurring in 2020.

data.annotation: Key points extracted using a combination of state-of-the-art language models followed by human validation.

methods: Ground truth mapping with human validation
methodology.calculation: Metrics calculated using ground-truth key points compared to model outputs.
methodology.interpretation: Higher recall indicates more key points found in the responses, while higher precision indicates fewer wrong matches in key point extraction.
methodology.baseline_results: Existing models show lower performance on ArgCMV compared to ArgKP21.
methodology.validation: Manual validation of extracted key points by human annotators with high inter-annotator agreement.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: Collected data was anonymized by not linking comments back to authorship.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.consent_procedures: Data was collected passively and in accordance with Reddit’s API policy.
